pros: Amazing culture. The communication there is extremely thorough and everyone is always on the same page. They really set you up for success and are a great introduction into the industry. Amazing L&D.
cons: No salary for associates, just a stipend. Unclear career path.
No cash flow. Underpays employees + payroll delays. Technology is not impressive.
advice_to_mgmt: Pay people. Invest in technology. Less magic tricks, more value delivery.

pros: You are all in the same boat, unfortunately there is a hole in that boat and your leader keeps opening it wider.
cons: Low pay if any, long hours, little or no direction for interns who are DOING the work, no career path.
advice_to_mgmt: Seriously, start paying interns for slave labor and stop lying to your clients about your global reach. You are not the leading expert in Retention Mr. Hecht, if you were more people would stay.

pros: People are hands down the best part of the organization. It is clear the managers care about us and the client experience. Job stretch projects are frequent.
cons: In service industry where might not have the project you want all the time. Unclear career growth. People can move up, no clear open positions or departments to fall into.
advice_to_mgmt: Transparency on growth and fiscal strength with less buzz words. Increase compensation. Hire more people for improved work load or work life balance.

pros: The people, the culture, the opportunity to make mistakes and grow from them.
cons: Little opportunity for advancement and career progression. Compensation.

pros:
Great place to start career and be exposed to different industries, as well as data analystic skills
Work-life balance
cons:
Lack of clear direction or expectations on assignments
Lack of interactive trainings to both show the employees what different projects would look like, and also to feel better equipped to succeed.
Infrequent performance and professional development conversations for more immediate and constructive feedback

review_title: Excellent Opportunity In Leading Edge Company
years_at_company: Excellent Opportunity In Leading Edge Company
pros:
Exceptionally smart leadership.
Unlimited growth opportunities.
Clients in wide variety of industries.
Leading edge technological solutions.
Opportunity to develop your own role and unique value within Retensa.
cons: Must be able to function independently, in a fast moving environment, with constantly changing priorities. Employees must find a balance between creativity and dependable, repeatable processes.
advice_to_mgmt: Biggest challenge to conquer is with marketing, and sales. Solutions are excellen. Focus on having sales create the level of demand that forces delivery capabilities to grow in capacity.

review_title: Great place to start your career
years_at_company: Great place to start your career
pros:
-Management will try everything within their power to give you what you want to grow and learn. The work is challenging but it's tailored to you as long as you speak up.
-Get to work with real clients
-People are fun, smart, and friendly.
cons:
-They ask for A LOT from interns. Be prepared to work hard and give your best work and efforts.
-Not enough personnel
advice_to_mgmt:
-Pay interns at least minimum wage.
-Give opportunities/reasons to stay in the company for a long time, like pay and transparency on where the company is going in the future.
-Hire more F/T people

pros: Invaluable learning opportunity to be exposed to/involved in different kinds of projects and actual client work. The constant feedback allowed for incredible personal growth/development. I would highly recommend this experience for anyone who is extremely self-directed and self-driven.
cons: Sometimes lack of clear direction or expectations on assignments; sometimes did not feel like I had the training to do my job well.

pros: stretch work, variety of projects, peers/loyalty, culture, growing company
cons: workload, unstructured professional development, work/life balance
advice_to_mgmt: hire mid-level to experienced managers for support

review_title: Great place to do really good work
years_at_company: Great place to do really good work
pros: They hire smart people, and friendly people. Most people worked very hard, really hard. You do real consulting. And most days I looked at the clock and the day was over fast, that's how it should be. They figured out how find people who want to be in this field and want talk about it, and enjoy doing it.
cons: If anyone was not willing to work, they may complain. Some people just didn't want to be in this industry. If you like these kind of projects there is plenty to do, so you are busy every day.

pros: have opportunity to work directly with clients
cons: cannot get compensation during the intern

pros: I had several internships before Retensa, and they were definitely the best out of all of them. The people there care about you and that you are growing and learning. I think they gave me the first chance to prove what I could do, and they trusted me to do it. The owner listened to me (as an intern!) and wants everyone to have an opportunity. Everyone that I knew that worked there said that. I told others to apply, and they all worked hard, but had fun (they do contests in the middle of the day!), and learned so so much. Great experience.
cons: Moves really fast, but would be bored if it didn't.

pros: Work directly on client projects to understand the nature of OD/HR consulting and to develop tangible skills for your resume. If you work hard and do good work you will be recognized.
cons: You are overworked and not paid although you are treated like a paid employee. Sometimes the CEO forgets this and pushes interns too hard. The company doesn't have enough full time staff to function effectively and this can sometimes negatively affect interns who don't get enough guidance and can be stuck doing repetitive or simple tasks.
advice_to_mgmt: 1) pay your interns at least minimum wage, it is illegal for them to do client work and not get paid, and you will see a return on it 2) Invest in more paid staff to support and retain the staff you have now 3) operate with transparency to keep interns from becoming disenheartened

review_title: Excellent experience, great colleagues, and a pleasure to come to work.
years_at_company: Excellent experience, great colleagues, and a pleasure to come to work.
pros:
- offered alot of responsibility
- great training provided
- autonomy available
- you can make your time what you want it to be
cons: - it is a small company which provides limited experience in terms of getting experience working in a large orgnaizational setting

review_title: A good place to get exprience
years_at_company: A good place to get exprience
pros: Retensa understands what needs to be done to make employees happy.
cons: Because of their size and a particular personality in management it is difficult to exercise what Retensa knows.
advice_to_mgmt: Onboarding training could be more thorough.

review_title: Good experience, no or very low compensation, fun and friendly culture
years_at_company: Good experience, no or very low compensation, fun and friendly culture
pros: Great client-facing experience in OD consulting. Perfect internship for I/O Psych or HR majors interested in OD consulting. Master's degree interns only.
cons: You do valuable work for free or almost free. But the experience and learning gained really compensates for that fact.
advice_to_mgmt:
Better pro-activity, some projects are thrown at Associates at the last minute.
Sometimes it would be good to practice more of what Retensa preaches- in recognition, praise, and appreciation.

review_title: A good place to have hands on experience on organizational development issues
years_at_company: A good place to have hands on experience on organizational development issues
cons: Need to possess certain experience to get involved with their core business
advice_to_mgmt: Maybe consider higher compensation to attract more entry-level talents
